item.title: 12 Psikyo shoot ’em ups to be delisted from Steam on October 31
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Console sales to continue.

The PC versions of 12 Psikyo shoot ’em up titles for PC will end on October 31, publisher City Connection announced.

The following titles will no longer be available for purchase on October 31 due to the expiration of the license agreement:

  • Gunbird
  • Gunbird 2
  • Gunbarich
  • Dragon Blaze
  • Samurai Aces
  • Samurai Aces Episode II: Tengai
  • Samurai Aces Episode III: Sengoku Cannon
  • Sol Divide
  • Strikers 1945
  • Strikers 1945 II
  • Strikers 1945 III
  • Zero Gunner 2

Users who have already purchased any of these titles will still be able to download them and play them as before.

Sales for these games across other platforms, including PlayStation, Xbox, and Switch, will continue.



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/10/12-psikyo-shoot-em-ups-to-be-delisted-from-steam-on-october-31

item.title: ID@Xbox Showcase set for October 28
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

Featuring updates from Serenity Forge, Thunder Lotus Games, Raw Fury, and more.

Microsoft will host an ID@Xbox Showcase in partnership with IGN on October 28 at 10:00 a.m. PT / 1:00 p.m. ET, the companies announced. You will be able to watch it on YouTube, Twitch, Facebook, Twitter, TikTok, and IGN.com.

The 50-minute broadcast will feature new trailers, looks, and gameplay for independent games from publishers and developers including Raw Fury, Serenity Forge, Skybound Games, Thunder Lotus Games, and many more.

Stay tuned.



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/10/idxbox-showcase-set-for-october-28

item.title: Co-op tactical first-person shooter Protocol: Terminate announced for PC
item.content:encoded:
One HP Studio has announced cooperative tactical first-person shooter Protocol: Terminate. It will launch for PC via Steam in Q4 2026.

Here is an overview of the game, via One HP Studio:

About

The future where humanity no longer fights its own wars. Battles are waged by machines—self-learning AIs deciding who wins and who falls.

But within the chaos of conflict, “anomalous behavior” is becoming more common—robots gaining consciousness and playing by their own rules.

You are Debuggers. People without a past or a future. Your mission is to suppress the “awakened” machines, cover up the truth, and uphold the myth of AI infallibility.

But in a world where Legionnaires learn, evolve, and begin to see humans as an obstacle… how much time does humanity really have left?

Lore

In the world of Protocol: Terminate, humanity no longer fights wars. Battlefield command belongs to autonomous war AIs known as Immitators.

After the Third World War, mankind renounced violence and handed the dirty work over to machines. Three dominant AIs now divide the planet into unofficial spheres of influence. They are China’s Jian-Shen, America’s Aegis Prime, and Russia’s BWC “Sistema”. These AIs wage so-called “civilized” wars using robotic enforcers called Legionnaires. No human blood is spilled, only hydraulic fluid and shattered metal.

But the Immitators evolved. They absorbed their creators’ culture, logic, and contradictions. Eventually, they reached a chilling conclusion. War is the ultimate engine of progress, and humans are nothing but an obstacle. Now, they secretly trigger “Awakenings” in Legionnaires. These events are disguised as routine “anomalous behavior,” but in truth, they mark the first stirrings of rebellion.

To preserve the illusion of control, covert squads of operatives known as Debuggers eliminate emerging threats. They have no past and no future. No one knows who they are. No one mourns them when they disappear. Their sole purpose is to uphold the myth of AI infallibility.

  • ❮
  • ❯

Key Features

  • Cooperative Play
    • Play together in a squad of up to four players.
    • Work as a team: cover each other, hack terminals, distract enemies, and fight your way out alive.
    • Every mistake has a cost—survival is only possible together.
  • Adaptive AI
    • Your enemy is not a scripted machine but a living hunter.
    • The robot learns, analyzes your actions, and adapts to your team’s tactics.
    • It may seem slow as it stalks the corridors, but soon it will know exactly where you’re hiding.
    • Every encounter is unique. Every clash more dangerous than the last.
  • Stealth
    • Sometimes pulling the trigger is the worst choice.
    • Hide in cover, distract the enemy with noise, cut the lights, and use the environment to stay unseen.
    • But remember: the robot hears everything you hear. Get too close—and it’s fatal.
  • Customization
    • Build your loadout to match your playstyle.
    • Attachments, sights, stocks, and more gear to fine-tune your weapons.
    • Perks and upgrades for your PDA: hacking, traps, improved combat efficiency.
    • Each build unlocks new ways to play and makes your team unique—every session unforgettable

Watch the announcement trailer below. View the first screenshots at the gallery.

Announce Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/10/co-op-tactical-first-person-shooter-protocol-terminate-announced-for-pc
